intro: Aosa, commonly known as the sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to red. The plant typically grows in saline or brackish environments, showcasing its adaptability to coastal conditions. Its leaves are usually broad and waxy, helping to reduce water loss in salty air. Aosa is often used in ornamental gardening due to its vibrant blooms and resilience to coastal climates.
